intro: Myoxanthus punctatus, commonly known as the spotted myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
